1.name: North by Northwest
1.description: A New York City advertising executive goes on the run after being mistaken for a government agent by a group of foreign spies.

2.name: Some Like It Hot
2.description: When two male musicians witness a mob hit, they flee the state in an all-female band disguised as women, but further complications set in.

3.name: The Devil's Disciple
3.description: The black sheep of a family and the local minister discover their true vocations during the Revolutionary War.

4.name: John Paul Jones
4.description: The career of Revolutionary War naval hero from his youth in Scotland through his service to Catherine the Great of Russia.

5.name: Ben-Hur
5.description: When a Jewish prince is betrayed and sent into slavery by a Roman friend, he regains his freedom and comes back for revenge.

6.name: Sleeping Beauty
6.description: After being snubbed by the royal family, a malevolent fairy places a curse on a princess which only a prince can break, along with the help of three good fairies.

7.name: Rio Bravo
7.description: A small-town sheriff in the American West enlists the help of a cripple, a drunk, and a young gunfighter in his efforts to hold in jail the brother of the local bad guy.

8.name: Anatomy of a Murder
8.description: In a murder trial, the defendant says he suffered temporary insanity after the victim raped his wife. What is the truth, and will he win his case?

9.name: The Horse Soldiers
9.description: In 1863, a Union outfit is sent behind Confederate lines in Mississippi to destroy enemy railroads but a captive southern belle and the unit's doctor cause frictions within ranks.

10.name: Expresso Bongo
10.description: Johnny Jackson, a sleazy talent agent, discovers teenager Bert Rudge singing in a coffee house. Despite Bert's protestation that he really is only interested in playing bongos, Johnny ...                See full summary »

11.name: Pillow Talk
11.description: A man and a woman who share a party line cannot stand each other, but he has fun romancing her with his voice disguised.

12.name: On the Beach
12.description: After a global nuclear war, the residents of Australia must come to terms with the fact that all life will be destroyed in a matter of months.

13.name: Les quatre cents coups
13.description: A young boy, left without attention, delves into a life of petty crime.

14.name: Plan 9 from Outer Space
14.description: Evil aliens attack Earth and set their terrible "Plan 9" in action. As the aliens resurrect the dead of the Earth to destroy the living, our lives are in danger.

15.name: A Hole in the Head
15.description: Widower Tony is trying to keep a small Miami hotel afloat while raising a 12-year-old son. He's forced to ask his harried brother Mario for help, but he'll only bail Tony out if he quits his bohemian lifestyle and marries a sensible woman.

16.name: Operation Petticoat
16.description: During World War II, a commander finds himself stuck with a decrepit (and pink) submarine, a con man executive officer, and a group of army nurses.

17.name: Deadly Record
17.description: An airline pilot, falsely accused of wife-murder, sets out to find who really did it.

18.name: House on Haunted Hill
18.description: A millionaire offers $10,000 to five people who agree to be locked in a large, spooky, rented house overnight with him and his wife.

19.name: Suddenly, Last Summer
19.description: The only son of wealthy widow Violet Venable dies while on vacation with his cousin Catherine. What the girl saw was so horrible that she went insane; now Mrs. Venable wants Catherine lobotomized to cover up the truth.

20.name: Imitation of Life
20.description: An aspiring actress befriends a black widow, but trouble arises when the latter is rejected by her daughter, who tries to pass for white.

21.name: Yellowstone Kelly
21.description: In 1870s, in the Sioux territory south of the Missouri, trapper and Indian scout Luther Yellowstone Kelly is hired by the army at Fort Buford but runs into trouble with the Sioux.

22.name: Tiger Bay
22.description: A twelve-year-old tomboy witnesses the murder of a woman by her Polish merchant marine boyfriend, but bonds with him and thwarts the police in their investigation.

23.name: Warlock
23.description: A famous gunman becomes the marshal of Warlock to end a gang's rampages, but is met with some opposition by a former gang member turned deputy sheriff who wants to follow only legal methods.

24.name: Darby O'Gill and the Little People
24.description: A wily old codger matches wits with the King of the Leprechauns and helps play matchmaker for his daughter and the strapping lad who has replaced him as caretaker.

25.name: Solomon and Sheba
25.description: After becoming king of ancient Israel, Solomon faces threats coming from his jealous dispossessed brother Adonijah, the Egyptian Pharaoh and the scheming Queen of Sheba.

26.name: Journey to the Center of the Earth
26.description: An Edinburgh professor and assorted colleagues follow an explorer's trail down an extinct Icelandic volcano to the earth's center.

27.name: Face of a Fugitive
27.description: A robber in custody, becomes wanted for murder when his younger brother kills a deputy sheriff to help him escape.

28.name: The Wild and the Innocent
28.description: In Wyoming, mountain trapper Yancy goes to the nearest town to trade his pelts but gets into trouble when he tries to save runaway saloon girl Rosalie from her shameful job.

29.name: The Hanging Tree
29.description: Character study of a Doctor who saves a local criminal from a mob who are trying to hang him, but then tries to control the life of the young man, realizing that he can exploit his secret.

30.name: Orfeu Negro
30.description: A retelling of the Orpheus and Eurydice myth, set during the time of the Carnaval in Rio de Janeiro.

31.name: Gidget
31.description: A young girl discovers surfing and love (in that order) during one transitive summer.

32.name: The Diary of Anne Frank
32.description: During World War II, a teenage Jewish girl named Anne Frank and her family are forced into hiding in the Nazi-occupied Netherlands.

33.name: A Summer Place
33.description: A self-made businessman rekindles a romance with a former flame while their two teenage children begin a romance of their own with drastic consequences for both couples.

34.name: Ohayô
34.description: Two boys begin a silence strike to press their parents into buying them a television set.

35.name: Hiroshima mon amour
35.description: A French actress filming an anti-war film in Hiroshima has an affair with a married Japanese architect as they share their differing perspectives on war.

36.name: The Mummy
36.description: In 1895, British archaeologists find and open the tomb of Egyptian Princess Ananka with nefarious consequences.

37.name: Pork Chop Hill
37.description: During the Korean War peace talks, U.S. troops fight to retake a hill from the Communist Chinese forces.

38.name: The Last Angry Man
38.description: An aspiring journalist's story of his aged uncle doctor leads to the uncle's life being profiled on TV.

39.name: The Nun's Story
39.description: After leaving a wealthy Belgian family to become a nun, Sister Luke struggles with her devotion to her vows during crisis, disappointment, and World War II.

40.name: Our Man in Havana
40.description: Jim Wormold, who is a vacuum cleaner salesman, participates as an Agent in the British Secret Service. But he soon realizes that his plans by lying are going to get him into trouble.

41.name: Li'l Abner
41.description: As Sadie Hawkins Day approaches, Daisy Mae hopes to win the hand of Li'l Abner by catching him in the traditional race. A senator comes to visit to tell the residents of Dogpatch that their...                See full summary »

42.name: The Bridal Path
42.description: Based on a novel by Nigel Tranter, The Bridal Path is a light-hearted look at the somewhat unfortunate results that can come of the continued marrying of fairly close cousins in a ...                See full summary »

43.name: Room at the Top
43.description: An ambitious young accountant plots to wed a wealthy factory owner's daughter, despite falling in love with a married older woman.

44.name: Das indische Grabmal
44.description: A German architect runs away with the maharajah of Eschnapur's fiancee but is caught and thrown in the dungeon, while his relatives arrive from Europe looking for him and the maharajah's brother is scheming to usurp the throne.

45.name: Porgy and Bess
45.description: A woman whose past is scorned by nearly everyone around her meets a man who'd love her regardlessly- if only everyone else would allow them to.

46.name: The Rough and the Smooth
46.description: Young blonde woman seems to destroy everyone she comes in contact with.

47.name: Ballada o soldate
47.description: Young Russian soldier Alyosha earns a medal, but asks to visit his mother instead. His journey recounts various kinds of love during wartime.

48.name: La legge
48.description: Illicit passions pervade an Italian town, where men gather nightly for the cynical "game of the law."

49.name: Last Train from Gun Hill
49.description: A marshal tries to bring the son of an old friend, an autocratic cattle baron, to justice for his role in the rape and murder of the marshal's Native American wife.

50.name: It Happened to Jane
50.description: Jane Osgood runs a lobster business, which supports her two young children. Railroad staff inattention ruins her shipment, so with her lawyer George, Jane sues Harry Foster Malone, director of the line and the "meanest man in the world".
